cont.entity_a: Stopped working in less than a year. A bit off at 200mm and up; manual focus is recommended. Problematic in low light, but manual focus can overcome this. Slow and loud, causing some photos to be unusable due to shake. Slow but lens is a good value for the price.
Issues with unauthorized sellers. Repair service by Tamron was quick, but shipping was at user's expense. 6-year warranty and includes a lens hood.
cont.entity_b: Fast and efficient replacement service from Amazon.
Excellent build quality, justifying the price.

cont.entity_a: Picture quality is good. No image stabilization, but still produces great pictures. Takes nice clear shots but not meant for fast-moving sports. Good quality for the price. Decreases at extreme zoom, but still a good lens for the price. Sharp and performs well in mid to long range shooting.
cont.entity_b: Amazing results with 70-200mm f2.8 lens and 2X converter. Tack-sharp images and great bokeh for portraits.

cont.entity_a: Noisy and slow, not suitable for astrophotography due to lens creep. Noisy and the macro/normal button froze.
cont.entity_b: SSM is quiet and fast, enhancing lens performance.

cont.entity_a: Less expensive compared to other lenses. Good value for the price.
cont.entity_b: Worth the price for high-end cameras, especially full-frame.

cont.entity_a: Lightweight and less expensive compared to other lenses. Lightweight for its size.
Manual focus is recommended. Without stabilization, a tripod is necessary.
cont.entity_b: Performs well in low light with Sony video camera.

cont.entity_a: Lens started getting an error about dirty contacts after 7 months despite being clean.
cont.entity_b: Intermittent overexposure issue with initial lens; replacement works perfectly.

cont.entity_a: Good for photography in good lighting conditions. Good quality lens for beginners and semi-pro photographers.
